sen.j: 津田 算長（つだ かずなが（さんちょう）、明応8年（1499年）頃 - 永禄10年12月22日 (旧暦)～12月23日 (旧暦)（1568年1月21日～1月22日）頃）は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Kazunaga (Sancho) TSUDA (1499 - December 22, 1568) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Kazunaga (Sancho) TSUDA (1499 - January 22 or 23, 1568) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 没年月日は新暦を採用しました。
sen.e: Kazunaga (Sancho) TSUDA (1499 - January 22 or 23, 1568) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Kenmotsu TSUDA.
Kenmotsu TSUDA.
Kenmotsu TSUDA.
Kazunaga SUGINOBO.
Kazunaga SUGINOBO.
Kazunaga SUGINOBO.

sen.j: 弟に津田妙算、子に津田算正、杉ノ坊照算、津田有直がいる。
sen.e: He had four younger brothers Taekazu TSUDA, Kazumasa TSUDA, Shozan SUGINOBO and Arinao TSUDA.
He had a younger brother Taekazu TSUDA, and his children included Kazumasa TSUDA, Shozan SUGINOBO and Arinao TSUDA.
sen.cmt: 3人は子供の名前なので全文書換えとしました。
sen.e: He had a younger brother Taekazu TSUDA, and his children included Kazumasa TSUDA, Shozan SUGINOBO and Arinao TSUDA.

sen.j: 津田正信を祖とした楠木氏一族の末裔を名乗る。
sen.e: They claimed to be the descendant of Kusunoki clan, which was founded by Masanobu TSUDA.
He claimed to be a descendant of Kusunoki clan founded by Masanobu TSUDA.
sen.cmt: They claimed to be the descendant をHe claimed to be a descendantとし、which was を削除しました。
sen.e: He claimed to be a descendant of Kusunoki clan founded by Masanobu TSUDA.
He was a lord of Hanzaki-jo Castle in Kii Province.
He was a lord of Hanzaki-jo Castle in Kii Province.
He was a lord of Hanzaki-jo Castle in Kii Province.
He was the head of sohei (warrior monk) in Negoro-ji Temple.
He was the head of sohei (warrior monks) in Negoro-ji Temple.
He was the head of sohei (warrior monks) in Negoro-ji Temple.
He was the founder of 'Tsuda-ryu gunnery'.
He was the founder of 'Tsuda-ryu hojutsu' (gunnery of Tsuda school).
sen.cmt: Tsuda-ryu gunnery'を'Tsuda-ryu hojutsu' (gunnery of Tsuda school)としました。
sen.e: He was the founder of 'Tsuda-ryu hojutsu' (gunnery of Tsuda school).

sen.j: 自ら種子島に渡り、領主・種子島時堯から一丁の種子島銃を買い、職人・芝辻清右衛門に鉄砲を複製させた。
sen.e: He traveled to Tanegashima Island and bought a Tanegashima rifle from the feudal lord Tokitaka TANEGASHIMA, and made a craftsman Seiemon SHIBATSUJI to reproduce the teppo (gun).
He traveled to Tanegashima Island and bought a Tanegashima rifle from the feudal lord Tokitaka TANEGASHIMA, and made Seiemon SHIBATSUJI, a craftsman, to reproduce the rifle (teppo).
sen.cmt: the teppo を先行する語に合わせrifleとしました。
sen.e: He traveled to Tanegashima Island and bought a Tanegashima rifle from the feudal lord Tokitaka TANEGASHIMA, and made Seiemon SHIBATSUJI, a craftsman, to reproduce the rifle (teppo).

sen.j: 鉄砲技術を算長が関西に持ち込んだ事によって、紀伊・堺市などは鉄砲の大量生産国となった。
sen.e: Because Kazunaga brought back art of teppo in to Kansai region, Kii and Sakai City became the province of mass teppo production.
Because Kazunaga introduced gunnery to Kansai region, Kii Province, typically Sakai City, became a place of mass production of guns.
sen.cmt: bring backは「元の場所に戻す」意であることからここでは不適当です。全文書換えとしました。
sen.e: Because Kazunaga introduced gunnery to Kansai region, Kii Province, typically Sakai City, became a place of mass production of guns.

sen.j: なお、『鉄炮記』ではもともと種子島の住人であったとしている。
sen.e: According to "Teppoki" (a history book on the introduction of guns), Kazunaga is said to be a man originally from Tanegashima Island.
"Teppoki" (a history book on the introduction of guns) describes Kazunaga as originally living in Tanegashima Island.
"Teppoki" (a history book on the introduction of guns) describes Kazunaga as originally living in Tanegashima Island.
He died in 1567.
He died in 1567.
He died in 1567.
He died at age of 69.
He died at age of 69.
He died at age of 69.
